intro: Asclepias zanthodacryon, commonly known as the yellow-green milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-green flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, with a rough texture. It serves as a host plant for the larvae of several butterfly species, including the monarch and queen butterflies.
